result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan E Ruiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Juan E Ruiz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Juan E Ruiz was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Juan E Ruiz was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$443  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

Def is to comply with DCHS-Chapter 51.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
$253  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan E Ruiz

Defendant in court with Attorney Murali Sreenivasurao Jasti.  Corey Stephan appeared for the State of Wisconsin; Atty Jasti will be hiring private investigator for NGI eval; a status conferernce will be set in approx 45 days; Ct amended bond condition

The court orders a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.   If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2,500.00, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Tiffany B. or any members of her family. or Ma'Kaio G. or Trinity G. or Sincere W.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
